p: In the literature on sustainable supply chain management, a popular topic is the relationship between internal and external factors and the adoption of environmental practices among suppliers (Zhu et al. 2007; Long and Young, 2016). Interestingly, there are few empirical investigations of whether climate change strategies of suppliers indeed differ from those pursued by their focal companies (Jira and Toffel, 2013). According to Kolk and Pinkse ( 2007b, p. 374), ‘the position of the company in the supply chain determines to which extent a company depends on its customers and thus follows a concomitant climate strategy’. While suppliers predominantly conduct business‐to‐business activities, OEMs are closer to the end consumer and therefore susceptible to a higher degree of stakeholder pressure (Bansal and Roth, 2000; Haddock‐Fraser and Tourelle, 2010). On this basis, we expect that, compared with suppliers, automobile manufacturers generally pursue more proactive strategies in response to climate change.
